@Kaex wrote:

It looks fine but you did a capital MAC and mac, try it as Mac for the title? I don’t understand why you did it in hole caps. Looks perfectly fine in my eyes other than that…

item.title: Randomizing login bytes?
item.dc:creator: @D_D_3 D D 3
item.description:
@D_D_3 wrote:

I don’t know if I worded the title wrong but i’m trying to randomize the mac address bytes that are being sent at login with a client i’m using.

Currently the mac address is taken by the client using the following method:

private static void getMAC() { try { System.out.println((new StringBuilder("client.getMAC: starting - webClient=")).append(signlink.webClient).toString()); InetAddress address = InetAddress.getLocalHost(); NetworkInterface ni = NetworkInterface.getByInetAddress(address); if(ni != null) { mac = ni.getHardwareAddress(); if(mac == null) System.out.println("MAC Address doesn't exist or is not accessible."); } } }
And sent through the login like so:

aStream_847.writeWord(mac.length); aStream_847.writeBytes(mac, mac.length, 0); public static byte mac[];

I feel like i’m close to my goal but I can’t figure out how exactly to do this LOL. I know how many characters are in the mac address itself so I don’t have a problem randomizing the actual address.

Read full topic
